name: TerraformTask
description: Execute terraform commands to manage resources on Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services(AWS), Google Cloud Platform(GCP) and Oracle Cloud Infrastructure(OCI). v5.255.1
author: Microsoft Corporation

groups.name: providerAzureRm
groups.displayName: Azure provider configuration (AzureRM, AzureAD and AzAPI)

inputs.name: provider
inputs.label: Provider
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The name of the provider used in the terraform configuration files.
Only one provider must be specified in the terraform configuration files in the below specified configuration directory.

inputs.name: command
inputs.label: Command
inputs.helpMarkDown: The terraform command to execute.

inputs.name: workingDirectory
inputs.label: Configuration directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Directory containing the Terraform configuration files. The default value is $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)

inputs.name: commandOptions
inputs.label: Additional command arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Any additional arguments for the selected command such as '-option=value' or '-flag'. Multiple options can also be provided delimited by spaces.

Examples:
-out=tfplan (for terraform plan)
tfplan -auto-approve (for terraform apply)

inputs.name: outputTo
inputs.label: Output to
inputs.helpMarkDown: choose output to file or console.

inputs.name: customCommand
inputs.label: Custom command
inputs.helpMarkDown: The custom terraform command to execute.

inputs.name: outputFormat
inputs.label: Output format
inputs.helpMarkDown: choose format of ouput for show cmd.

inputs.name: fileName
inputs.label: Output Filename
inputs.helpMarkDown: filename of output

inputs.name: environmentServiceNameAzureRM
inputs.label: Azure Provider Service Connection
inputs.visibleRule: provider = azurerm && command != init && command != validate
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure Resource Manager Service Connection for the Azure providers

inputs.name: environmentAzureRmOverrideSubscriptionID
inputs.label: Subscription ID Override
inputs.visibleRule: provider = azurerm && command != init && command != validate
inputs.helpMarkDown: Used to override the subscription ID that the provider will target by default. This is set to the ARM_SUBSCRIPTION_ID environment variable. It will use the service connection subscription ID by default.

inputs.name: environmentServiceNameAWS
inputs.label: Amazon Web Services connection
inputs.visibleRule: provider = aws && command != init && command != validate
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select an Amazon Web Services connection for the deployment.

Note: If your connection is not listed or if you want to use an existing connection, you can setup an Amazon Web Services service connection using the 'Add' or 'Manage' button.

inputs.name: environmentServiceNameGCP
inputs.label: Google Cloud Platform connection
inputs.visibleRule: provider = gcp && command != init && command != validate
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select a Google Cloud Platform connection for the deployment.

Note: If your connection is not listed or if you want to use an existing connection, you can setup a Google Cloud Platform service connection using the 'Add' or 'Manage' button.

inputs.name: environmentServiceNameOCI
inputs.label: Oracle Cloud Platform connection
inputs.visibleRule: provider = oci && command != init && command != validate
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select a Oracle Cloud Platform connection for the deployment.

Note: If your connection is not listed or if you want to use an existing connection, you can setup a Oracle Cloud Platform service connection using the 'Add' or 'Manage' button.

inputs.name: backendAzureRmUseEntraIdForAuthentication
inputs.label: Use Entra ID for Authentication
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose whether to use Entra Id authentication to the storage account. If selected, the use_azuread_auth variable will be set to true.

inputs.name: backendServiceArm
inputs.label: Azure Backend Service Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure Resource Manager Service Connection for the terraform azurerm backend configuration

inputs.name: backendAzureRmOverrideSubscriptionID
inputs.label: Subscription ID Override
inputs.helpMarkDown: Used to override the ID of the subscription which contains the storage account. (Only required for URI lookup)

inputs.name: backendAzureRmResourceGroupName
inputs.label: Resource group
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the resource group which contains the storage account. (Only required for URI lookup)

inputs.name: backendAzureRmStorageAccountName
inputs.label: Storage account
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the storage account which contains the Azure Blob container.

inputs.name: backendAzureRmContainerName
inputs.label: Container
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the Azure Blob container in which to store the Terraform remote state file.

inputs.name: backendAzureRmKey
inputs.label: Key
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The path to the Terraform remote state file inside the container.
For example, if you want to store the state file, named terraform.tfstate, inside a folder, named tf, then give the input 'tf/terraform.tfstate'

inputs.name: backendServiceAWS
inputs.label: Amazon Web Services connection
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Amazon Web Services connection for the terraform backend configuration.

Note: If your connection is not listed or if you want to use an existing connection, you can setup an Amazon Web Services service connection using the 'Add' or 'Manage' button.

inputs.name: backendAWSBucketName
inputs.label: Bucket
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The name of the Amazon Simple Storage Service(S3) bucket for storing the Terraform remote state file.

NOTE: The region of this bucket (e.g. us-east-1) must be specified in the AWS service connection that you must set up. To set up an AWS service connection, click on the 'Help(i)' button of the above input named 'Amazon Web Services connection'

inputs.name: backendAWSKey
inputs.label: Key
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The path to the state file inside the Amazon S3 bucket.
For example, if you want to store the state file, named terraform.tfstate, inside a folder, named tf, then give the input 'tf/terraform.tfstate'.

inputs.name: backendServiceGCP
inputs.label: Google Cloud Platform connection
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Google Cloud Platform connection for the terraform backend configuration.

Note: If your connection is not listed or if you want to use an existing connection, you can setup a Google Cloud Platform service connection using the 'Add' or 'Manage' button.

inputs.name: backendGCPBucketName
inputs.label: Bucket
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the GCP storage bucket for storing the Terraform remote state file.

inputs.name: backendGCPPrefix
inputs.label: Prefix of state file
inputs.helpMarkDown: The relative path to the state file inside the GCP bucket. For example, if you give the input as 'terraform', then the state file, named default.tfstate, will be stored inside an object called terraform.

inputs.name: backendServiceOCI
inputs.label: Oracle Cloud Infrastructure connection
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Oracle Cloud Infrastructure connection for the terraform backend configuration.

Note: If your connection is not listed or if you want to use an existing connection, you can setup a Oracle Cloud Platform service connection using the 'Add' or 'Manage' button.

inputs.name: backendOCIPar
inputs.label: PAR for Terraform remote state file
inputs.helpMarkDown: The OCI object storage PAR configuration for the Terraform remote state file (optional)

inputs.name: backendOCIConfigGenerate
inputs.label: Generate the Terraform remote state file config (Use Yes when not included in TF files)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Generates the Terraform remote state file config, select Yes when not included in TF files, othwerwise No.

outputVariables.name: jsonPlanFilePath
outputVariables.description:
The location of the terraform plan file in JSON format that was created. This file can be used by tasks which are written for tools such as [Open Policy Agent](https://www.openpolicyagent.org/docs/latest/terraform/)

Note: This variable will only be set if 'command' input is set to 'plan'.

outputVariables.name: jsonOutputVariablesPath
outputVariables.description:
The location of the JSON file which contains the output variables set by the user in the terraform config files.

Note: This variable will only be set if 'command' input is set to 'output'.

outputVariables.name: changesPresent
outputVariables.description: A boolean indicating if the terraform plan found any changes to apply.

messages.TerraformToolNotFound: Failed to find terraform tool in paths
